page.title: 07FARMING AROUND BISHOPS FROME
page.content: The block includes about 12 farms.Much grass is grown for silage, hay and grazing; these support beef cattle and sheep but there is no longer dairy herd. Cheyney Court Farm has a pedigree Hereford cattle herd. The main cereal crop is wheat, with a smaller amount of barley and even less oats. Hops are a traditional crop, used in beer production for the aroma and bitterness produced by resins and oils in the female flower. But hop-growing is declining because cheap imports from Europe and China are available and changing tastes favour lager, which does not need hops, rather than bitter beer. Another characteristic crop is apples. At Leighton Court Farm are extensive orchards of dessert and cooking apples. Many other farms grow cider apples to sell to local cider
